meanings.definition: The act of traveling from place to place.
meanings.sent1: Her itineracies around the city brought her joy.
meanings.sent2: The explorer's itineracies led him to discover new lands.
meanings.sent3: The cat's itineracies around the house always ended at the food bowl.
meanings.sent4: His itineracies through life's challenges made him stronger.
meanings.sent5: The itineracies of the migrating birds amazed the onlookers.

meanings.definition: A journey or route taken by a traveler.
meanings.sent1: The itineracies through the mountains were breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: She planned her itineracies carefully to visit all the landmarks.
meanings.sent3: The itineracies of the lost hiker took him in circles.
meanings.sent4: His itineracies in search of treasure were filled with danger.
meanings.sent5: The itineracies of the ancient traders shaped the region's history.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being itinerant.
meanings.sent1: The itineracies of his job kept him constantly on the move.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the freedom that came with the itineracies of her lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: The itineracies of the wandering minstrel entertained the villagers.
meanings.sent4: His itineracies as a nomad taught him valuable life lessons.
meanings.sent5: The itineracies of the circus performers captivated the audience.
